definition: inspector-general of province in Ming and Qing times
to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor

sentences.english: But Jesus made no reply, not even to a single charge--to the great amazement of the governor.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌仍不回答，連一句話也不說，以致巡撫甚覺希奇。

sentences.english: And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌仍不回答，連一句話也不說，以致巡撫甚覺希奇。

sentences.english: For he knew it was out of envy that they had handed Jesus over to him.
sentences.chinese: 巡撫原知道，他們是因爲嫉妒才把他解了來。

sentences.english: The governor-inspector system of Ming originates in the Jian-wen imperial and is basically established in the "Xuan-de period".
sentences.chinese: 明代巡撫制度萌芽於建文時，基本確立於宣德時期。

sentences.english: And Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews?
sentences.chinese: 耶穌站在巡撫面前，巡撫問他說，你是猶太人的王嗎。

sentences.english: And Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews?
sentences.chinese: 耶穌站在巡撫面前，巡撫問他說，你是猶太人的王嗎。

sentences.english: For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast .
sentences.chinese: 每逢這節期巡撫必須釋放一個囚犯給他們。

sentences.english: Meanwhile Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, "Are you the king of the Jews?
sentences.chinese: 耶穌站在巡撫面前，巡撫問他說，你是猶太人的王麼。

sentences.english: Meanwhile Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, "Are you the king of the Jews?
sentences.chinese: 耶穌站在巡撫面前，巡撫問他說，你是猶太人的王麼。

sentences.english: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him.
sentences.chinese: 巡撫原知道，他們是因爲嫉妒才把他解了來。

sentences.english: And if this come to the governor's ears, we will persuade him, and secure you.
sentences.chinese: 倘若這話被巡撫聽見，有我們勸他，保你們無事。

sentences.english: And provide them beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.
sentences.chinese: 也要豫備牲口叫保羅騎上，護送到巡撫腓力斯那裏去。

sentences.english: And when they had bound him, they led him away, and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor.
sentences.chinese: 就把他捆綁解去交給巡撫彼拉多。

sentences.english: They bound him, led him away and handed him over to Pilate, the governor.
sentences.chinese: 就把他捆綁解去交給巡撫彼拉多。

sentences.english: Administering the borderland was a practical problem faced by liu jin-tang the first provincial governor of xinjiang .
sentences.chinese: 邊疆治理是首任新疆巡撫劉錦棠所面臨的首要問題。

definition: Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing
Hubei and Hunan provinces (a Ming dynasty province)
Ming and Qing dynasty province directly administered by Beijing, including Beijing, Tianjin, most of Hebei and Henan and part of Shandong
candidate for the Imperial Examination proposed by a tributary state
Anlu county level city in Xiaogan 孝感[Xiao4 gan3], Hubei
Huaiyuan county in Bengbu 蚌埠[Beng4 bu4], Anhui
